headline: As Virus Resurges in Africa, Doctors Fear the Worst Is Yet to Come
snippet: The coronavirus killed far fewer people in Africa than in Europe and the Americas. Now, a tide of new cases on the continent is raising alarms.
abstract: The coronavirus killed far fewer people in Africa than in Europe and the Americas, leading to a widespread perception that it was a disease of the West. Now, a tide of new cases on the continent is raising alarms.

headline: Trump Officials Push Ambitious Vaccine Timeline as California Locks Down
snippet: Millions in California went into lockdown for at least three weeks today as federal officials said a vaccine could be distributed to as many as 24 million people by January.
abstract: As cases surge and hospital beds fill up, federal officials said a vaccine could be distributed to as many as 24 million people by mid-January.
byline: By Michael D. Shear, Apoorva Mandavilli and Jill Cowan

headline: As Virus Spreads, C.D.C. Draws Up an Urgent Battle Plan
snippet: The multipronged advice, for individuals and state and local officials, may augur a national strategy in the months to come, experts said.
abstract: The multipronged advice, for individuals and state and local officials, may augur a national strategy in the months to come, experts said.
byline: By Roni Caryn Rabin and Apoorva Mandavilli
